entry.title: How to create a measure in SAC that always shows a fixed month value regardless of the data filter
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud with an import model based on an Excel file.

I need to create a calculated measure that should always display the value of another measure restricted to a specific month (e.g., January), but it should remain visible across all months in the story, even if a date filter is applied.

Example:

  • I have a measure [Legacy Book Value Assets].

  • I want to create another measure that takes only the value of [Legacy Book Value Assets] for January 2025.

  • When I filter the story for June 2025, I still want this "January-based" measure to be displayed for every month (replicated), instead of disappearing because of the date filter.

I tried using a Restricted Measure for January, but when I change the date filter in the story, the measure goes blank.

Is there a way to define this logic directly in the model (calculated measure), so that the value for January remains visible across all months, regardless of the story filters?

Any workaround, formula example, model design best practice would be highly appreciated but please do not consider Data Action solutions.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: AATP Supply Protection with "physical stock" protection
entry.content:
Hello,
with Supply Protection it is possible to do this. However, protection has to be seen as "restriction for others". With the default setting of SUP the demand matching the highest priority could get the complete stock (if it comes first) as this demand doesn't need to consider the other protections as restriction.
There are also other settings and various options regarding the restriction logic, how time buckets with protected quantities have to be considered or how the own protected quantities are considered.
There is one quite comprehensive blog I like to recommend: Supply Protection In a Nutshell - SAP Community

entry.title: Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters
entry.content:
Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters

Have you ever wondered how many key user custom fields you could add to a specific business context? If so, this blog post is for you.

This blog post covers the following topics:

  • The maximum number of key user custom fields you can add
  • The maximum overall number of characters consumed by key user custom fields

Please note that for all S/4HANA editions, the actual numbers for the maximum fields and maximum overall number characters supported strongly depend on the S/4HANA release. In general, the maximum number of fields and the maximum overall number of characters consumed by key user custom fields have been significantly increased over time.

S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you can figure out easily how much capacity for a given business context is left. This is directly shown while creating a new field using the Custom Fields app (see screenshot below).

Business Context Capacity

The field “Business Context Capacity” displays a percentage number telling you which percentage of the overall available capacity reserved for customers has already been consumed. When you hover over the “Business Context Capacity” bar, you see how many fields and how many bytes are available (see screenshot). As a rule of thumb, you can divide the number of bytes by factor 2 to get the free number of characters.

Please note that for each business context, the responsible SAP application department defines the capacity available for customers individually. The only guard rail that exists is that the number of fields reserved for customers is never less than 100 fields and never less than 1000 characters.
If the available business context capacity is not sufficient for you, please create a request via the customer influence channel or create a customer ticket on the application component of the respective business context.

S/4HANA and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

In S/4HANA and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, the business context capacity limits are not considered at all. You can add key user custom fields until you reach the technical limits given by ABAP dictionary. As soon as you reach these limits, you'll no longer be able to add additional key user custom fields. A popup will tell you that there is no more space left to create key user custom fields.

These limits are very high. For SAP_BASIS releases above 7.95, no customer has reached these limits yet.

The ABAP dictionary limits relevant in this context are:

  1. The maximum number of fields: the maximum number of fields supported in a database table. Note that for counting them, it's not relevant whether this field is a SAP standard field or not
  2. The maximum table width: this figure tells you how many bytes at max per table entry in a database table are supported. Note that for counting them, it's not relevant whether the bytes originate from a SAP standard field or not

Let’s have a look at these limits:

  1. Maximum Number of Fields
    • A database table can have up to 749 fields by default
    • Since SAP-BASIS release 7.73, the limit increases to:
      • 1,500 fields for application tables with a 'Column' storage type.
      • 1,000 fields for application tables with a 'Row' storage type
    • Since SAP-BASIS release 9.16, the limit has been further increased to:
      • 3000 fields for application tables with a 'Column' storage type
      • 1,000 fields for application tables with a 'Row' storage type (remained unchanged)
  2. Maximum Table Width
    • By default, the maximum width of a table is 4,030 characters
    • With the TABLEN feature activated (DDIC table DD02L, field TABLEN_FEATURE), the limit increases to 16,293 characters
    • Since SAP-BASIS release 7.95, the table width limit has been extended further to 256,000 characters

With this, we are done. I hope this blog helps you understand what the limits of key user custom fields are regarding number of fields and number of bytes.

Feedback, Comments, or Questions:

You’re cordially invited to provide them in the comments section below. Please follow my profile to get updates when I publish more posts on these topics.
Feel invited to post and answer questions here (https://answers.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26) and read other posts on the topic (https://blogs.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26/).

I want to thank Yasmina van Rooij (YasminavanRooij), Karsten Schaser (Karsten_Schaser) for their extremely helpful contributions.

Other related blog posts (just a small selection of the blogs available for custom field extensibility)

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/convert-manually-created-append-fields-to-real-key-user-custom-fields/ba-p/13967399
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/key-user-custom-fields-in-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-and-on-premise-dos/ba-p/14026871

entry.title: What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2507
entry.content:
The 2507 release brings a set of thoughtful enhancements designed to improve your user experience and efficiency.

At the center of this release is our new View Rule Logs app, giving you immediate insight into rule execution and helping you take the right actions faster.

Let's take a closer look.

Introducing Our New App - 'View Rule Logs'

Understanding how your business rules perform is key to ensuring reliable automation. Our new app View Rule Logs, gives you real-time visibility into the execution of business rules—whether they ran successfully or encountered issues. With this insight, you can:

  • Verify execution outcomes, such as whether alerts were triggered, notifications were sent, or external events were created as expected.

  • View and take recommended follow-up actions

  • Quickly diagnose logic or data issues by pinpointing where rules failed due to missing inputs or configuration errors, so you don't have to work it out yourself.

Watch this short video to see it in action.

Video: View Rule Logs application

For more information, see the SAP Help Portal View Rule Logs.

 

Enhanced Filtering by Characteristic Value

The Characteristic Value value help popup in the Select Technical Object window has been enhanced in 2507 to improve usability and search efficiency.

Previously, users had to filter assets by first selecting a class and characteristic - even if they already knew the characteristic value. This was time-consuming and led to usability complaints.

With the new enhancements, users benefit from:

  • A Characteristic Value filter to refine results directly based on known values.
  • A free text search bar that quickly filters across class, characteristic and characteristic value fields.

Now, if a user knows the characteristic value (e.g. Voltage = 220V), they can enter it directly to filter assets. That means there's no need to navigate through class and characteristic first. The older method remains available for users who prefer it.

These improvements enable faster and more precise selection of technical objects, especially useful during assessments, recommendations, or rule processing.

Filter by characteristic value

Spot Critical Alerts Faster with Deduplication Count in List View

High-frequency alerts can indicate critical issues, but until now, spotting them at a glance wasn’t easy. Our latest enhancement to the Manage Alerts screen solves this by introducing a visible Deduplication Count directly in the list view.

This new column helps you immediately recognize which alert types are repeatedly triggering, without needing to open each alert detail page. 

The Deduplication Count is now available under column settings and is enabled by default. When deduplication is active, the count begins at zero and increases as duplicate alerts are grouped. This helps you prioritize action based on real-time alert frequency.

For added usability, a new Last Updated On column has also been positioned between Occurred On and Deduplication Count, making it easier to filter and track the most recent changes.

This small but powerful improvement brings greater clarity and responsiveness to alert management.

Stay Informed and Get Involved

    • For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.. 
    • Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.

See you soon for the 2508 update!

entry.title: Re: Access to Historical Production Orders incl. BOMs aft...
entry.content:
Hello Christian, thank you for your question!

Hope this help you a little bit!

  1. SAP Document Management Service (DMS)

    • SAP DMS can be used to manage and archive documents in a cloud environment. It provides document storage, versioning, and access control features that can be integrated with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

  2. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Archiving

    • SAP offers cloud-based archiving solutions that can be used to archive historical data. These solutions can be integrated with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to provide access to archived data.

  3. SAP Data Archiving Service (DAS) on SAP BTP

    • SAP DAS on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) provides data archiving capabilities for cloud environments. It allows you to archive historical data while maintaining access to it through predefined access patterns.

Data Migration

In addition to the migration approach “Migrate Data Using Staging Tables”, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud migration cockpit now facilitates the direct transfer of business data from an SAP ECC source system to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Using a communication arrangement to connect to the source system, it selects data automatically, i.e., it uses the selection criteria company code and the migration objects to identify and transfer relevant data. A migration object describes how to migrate data for a specific business object to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. To adjust the selection of data, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud migration object modeler can be used.  Get started now and visit the SAP Help portal for all related information! Visit here to see a comprehensive list of migration objects available for direct transfer.  <https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/highlights-of-the-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-2402-release/ba-p/13587480>

entry.title: Re: Error en nota de Criterio al articulo 29 de la Ley de...
entry.content:
Hola!

Gracias por sus comentarios.

Nos han reportado varios casos que no están generando los resultados esperados. Estos tienen que ver cuando hay retroactivos a periodos que tienen registros en las tabas DDNTK/ARRRS. Aquí, se están duplicando los pendientes de cobro. Para no hacer la explicación técnica larga, les comento que ya tenemos una propuesta para resolver esos casos. Ahora mismo varios clientes la están probando.

Para la opción 2 de la nota, el cambio en el subesquema MXIN es el siguiente:

Las reglas no cambian, sólo cambia el subesquema con el LPBEG ..... LPEND y el IMPRT.

Para la opción 3 el cambio es más largo y más complejo. Si alguien le interesa saber más al respecto me pueden enviar un correo: hu.rodriguez@sap.com 

En cuanto liberemos una nueva versión de la nota con estas dos actualizaciones se los haremos saber (al día de hoy continuamos en pruebas piloto con algunos clientes).

Espero esto sea de utilidad.

entry.title: Unlocking the Power of Events: A Deep Dive into the Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content:
Unlocking the Power of Events: A Deep Dive into the Event Add-on for ERP

In Part 1 of this blog series, we introduced SAP’s Event Add-on for ERP – a game-changer for integrating SAP ECC and S/4HANA more easily into event-driven architectures. In this follow-up article, we take a feature-focused look at the Add-on – exploring how it works, what technical capabilities it offers, why it plays a central role in decoupling, scalability, and agility when event-enabling SAP backends.

Whether you're running SAP ECC 6.0, SAP S/4HANA (on-premise or private cloud), or are currently in the process of transitioning between versions, the Event Add-on for ERP provides a no-code/low-code, flexible, and scalable way to enable real-time, event-driven communication across your SAP ecosystem.

A Feature-Rich Solution Built for Modern Integration

At its core, the Event Add-on for ERP enables SAP systems to send and receive business events in real-time.

It provides a robust framework for configuration, payload design, event triggering, and connectivity. Together, these components form a runtime and configuration layer that transforms traditional SAP applications into real-time event producers and consumers:

Building Blocks of the Event Add-On for ERP

At a high level, the Add-on operates by detecting meaningful changes in SAP business processes - such as the creation of a sales order, an update to a vendor record, or a goods movement posting - and translating them into well-structured event messages. These messages are then published to external systems through asynchronous, decoupled communication channels and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh as event broker.

The process begins in the SAP application layer, where various types of event triggers are captured. These triggers can originate from standard SAP mechanisms like Business Object Repository (BOR) events, Change Documents (CDHDR/CDPOS), IDoc creation, or Output Determination routines. In more modern S/4HANA systems, the Add-on can also listen to RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming) event triggers.

Once a trigger is detected, the Add-on initiates a payload generation process. Instead of requiring custom ABAP code, this process is driven by a visual tool called the Payload Designer. With this tool, users define the event content by selecting SAP tables, fields, joins, and optional filters. Hierarchical structures are also supported, as are CDS views and standard IDoc formats. The resulting payload is stored as a transportable configuration object, not code.

Payload Designer for codeless configuration of events

In the following paragraphs, the most impactful features are described in greater detail.

 

Codeless Event Design and Payload Configuration

One of the standout aspects of the Event Add-on for ERP is its Payload Designer, which enables users to define and configure outbound interfaces without writing a single line of code.

  • Visually select SAP tables, fields, and joins.
  • Design flat or hierarchical payloads using tables or CDS views.
  • Store configurations in transportable objects.
  • Extend or customize payloads with Z-fields or Z-tables as needed.

This approach reduces implementation time dramatically, especially for teams with limited ABAP skills.

One of the most compelling aspects of the Event Add-on is how flexibly it allows event definitions to be created, extended, or customized—all without modifying SAP standard code. In a typical scenario, a user begins by selecting from a rich library of predefined events. These cover common SAP objects such as sales orders, purchase orders, deliveries, goods movements, accounting documents, and many more.

If business needs go beyond the standard, users can extend these definitions. For example, you might add custom Z-fields to an existing payload or link additional SAP CDS views to include extra data. You can even build entirely custom events from scratch, using the Payload Designer, selecting any combination of fields, structures, and joins from the underlying SAP data model.

The outbound message design supports dynamic topics on the broker, so that consumers can subscribe to event topics based on content (e.g., only sales orders from a certain region) without hardcoding endpoints, which is a unique feature of SAP Advanced Event Mesh.

 

Supported Event Triggers – Flexibility Without Custom Coding

The Event Add-on supports a wide range of trigger types, enabling it to detect changes in both standard and custom business processes. These include:

Standard Triggers

  • SAP Business Object Repository (BOR) Events
  • SAP RAP Events (available for S/4HANA 2023+)
  • Change Documents (CDHDR/CDPOS)
  • SAP IDoc
  • Business Transaction Events (BTE)
  • SAP Output Determination

Custom Trigger Options

  • Manual ABAP triggers (function call to API)
  • Scheduled jobs (batch exports)
  • Custom object event registration via configuration

These triggers cover a wide spectrum: from high-volume transactional updates (e.g. goods movements) to master data changes (e.g. material or customer master).

The versatility in trigger definition allows for both real-time and batch-style processing.

 

Real-Time & Batch Processing Modes

You can configure the Add-on to push a message immediately when a record is created or changed, or to run scheduled jobs that extract and publish data in batches or micro-batches. The Add-on even supports initial full loads, making it suitable for bootstrapping event consumers or for high-volume use .

Depending on business needs, the Event Add-on supports:

  • Real-time push of single events
  • Scheduled batch transmissions or micro-batching for high-volume near-real-time events
  • Initial mass loads for historical data
  • Packed delta processing for optimal performance

This makes it ideal for hybrid scenarios: from low-latency retail use cases to massive data distribution across global instances.

 

Bi-Directional Integration: Outbound and Inbound

After the payload is created, the message is dispatched to the configured endpoint. The Add-on handles delivery asynchronously, with support for failover strategies, retries, and high-availability scenarios.

Events can not only be sent from SAP to external systems, making SAP and event - but also received into SAP from external event producers, making the Event Add-on a bi-directional component.

Inbound flows use JSON structures, which are mapped either to a standard IDoc or a generic IDoc structure and then handed off to BAPIs or custom logic for posting into the SAP system. In case the incoming structure corresponds to a standard IDoc in the SAP system, the event message can be mapped automatically to the IDoc. For custom structures, a mapping logic is required.

All outbound and inbound activity is traceable in the Add-on’s monitoring UI, and message content is stored for auditing or reprocessing.

 

Architecture & Connectivity

The Add-on is designed to work seamlessly with the SAP Business Technology Platform and especially SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh (AEM). It runs in the ABAP application layer and operates through modular components that handle both trigger detection and message creation.

Key Architecture Components (as found in the diagram above):

  • Event Trigger Layer: Connects to event sources and listens to changes: BOR events, IDocs, Change Docs, BTEs, RAP BOs
  • Outbound & Inbound Connectors: Communication with Advanced Event Mesh
  • Payload Designer: UI-based tool for codeless interface configuration and payload structures from tables or CDS views
  • Monitoring & Administration Console: For error handling, alerts, reprocessing

High-availability features like dynamic topic routing, failover, and endpoint confirmation ensure reliability and resiliency across cloud or hybrid environments.

 

Performance, Reliability, and Scalability

Scalability and performance have been built into the Add-on from the ground up. This is achieved through multi-threaded processing, efficient payload generation, and configurable performance thresholds making sure that end-users are not affected by large, parallelized background jobs.

Resilience is also a core feature. The monitoring UI allows administrators to track message status, identify errors, trigger automatic and manual reprocessing, and configure alerts for delivery failures or downstream issues. The system is designed for high availability, with failover support, retry queues, and robust error isolation.

These capabilities make the Add-on suitable not just for niche integration cases, but for enterprise-scale workloads where SAP serves as a real-time data source.

 

Governance

Event definitions created in the SAP Event Add-on for ERP can be exported as Async API specifications and imported into the Event Portal module of AEM. This way, event definitions can be catalogued and published for discovery by potential consumers. This facilitates re-use of events and promotes standardization of events and interfaces.

In addition, the add-on comes with a clean core check feature to validate the data sources used in the payload design. It recommends suitable CDS views as replacement of deprecated table views to support clean core readiness.

 

Summary: Why You Should Care

The Event Add-on for ERP offers a comprehensive, extensible, and modern way to bring SAP systems into the real-time, decoupled, cloud-first architecture demanded by today’s IT strategy.

Key Takeaways:

  • Unified framework for S/4HANA and SAP ECC: Works with both ECC and S/4HANA, supports migration and hybrid setups
  • No-code/low-code interface design
  • Accelerated Time-to-Event:  Go live quickly with predefined templates and no-code tooling
  • Real-time outbound & inbound integration
  • Full support for standard & custom events
  • Reduces maintenance cost compared to custom ABAP interfaces or legacy middleware
  • Clean-core compliant: Avoid deep customizations thanks to configuration-based design
  • Performance: Proven in enterprise environments with millions of events per day
  • Built-in monitoring, resilience & scalability

If you’re looking to break the chains of point-to-point integrations, simplify middleware, or begin your journey toward event-driven enterprise architecture – the Event Add-on for ERP is your gateway.

In the next part of this blog series, we will walk through a real configuration example: from event definition to payload creation, to endpoint delivery using SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. Stay tuned.

 

Links

Here are some links that provide you with additional information on the Event Add-On for ERP:

SAP Help: Connecting the Add-On to AEM

SAP Discovery Center for AEM and Event Add-On

Discovery Center Mission on Event Add-On for ERP and Advanced Event Mesh

entry.title: TMG Event 01: Error message in FORM on_save_change not showing immediately on screen
entry.content:
image_1image_2Hi expert, this is my sap abap code which i use to maintain event on table maintainance generator. In this code I have create a form on_save_change to handle event 01: Before saving the data in the database. In on_save_change form, i have create 2 code to validate email duplicate and empty key field value. But whenever i tried to test these two test case, the system always exit and then it show the message outside. Please give me detailed solution

FORM on_save_changes.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_field> TYPE any.

  " Existing loop to update audit fields for changed records
  LOOP AT total.
    CHECK <action> EQ aendern.
    ASSIGN COMPONENT 'AENAM' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_field>.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      <fs_field> = sy-uname.
    ENDIF.
    ASSIGN COMPONENT 'AEDAT' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_field>.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      <fs_field> = sy-datum.
    ENDIF.
    ASSIGN COMPONENT 'AEZET' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_field>.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      <fs_field> = sy-uzeit.
    ENDIF.
    READ TABLE extract WITH KEY <vim_xtotal_key>.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      extract = total.
      MODIFY extract INDEX sy-tabix.
    ENDIF.
    MODIFY total.
  ENDLOOP.

  " Check for duplicate EMAIL_ADDRESS
  DATA: lt_email TYPE HASHED TABLE OF string WITH UNIQUE KEY table_line,
        lv_email_lower TYPE string.
  FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_email> TYPE zsap03_email-email_address.

  LOOP AT total.
    ASSIGN COMPONENT 'EMAIL_ADDRESS' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_email>.
    IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <fs_email> IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_email_lower = to_lower( <fs_email> ).
      READ TABLE lt_email WITH KEY table_line = lv_email_lower TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        MESSAGE e022(zsap03_msg_cl) WITH <fs_email>.
      ELSE.
        INSERT lv_email_lower INTO TABLE lt_email.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.

" Check for empty key fields (assuming group 'KEY' corresponds to key fields)
  DATA: lt_fieldinfo TYPE TABLE OF dfies,
        ls_fieldinfo TYPE dfies.

  CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET'
    EXPORTING
      tabname        = 'ZSAP03_EMAIL'
    TABLES
      dfies_tab      = lt_fieldinfo
    EXCEPTIONS
      not_found      = 1
      internal_error = 2
      OTHERS         = 3.

  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    LOOP AT lt_fieldinfo INTO ls_fieldinfo WHERE keyflag = 'X'.
      LOOP AT total.
        ASSIGN COMPONENT ls_fieldinfo-fieldname OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_field>.
        IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <fs_field> IS INITIAL.
          MESSAGE e111(zsap03_msg_cl) WITH ls_fieldinfo-fieldname.
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

ENDFORM.

entry.title: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Indicator "S" (Checks Issued) in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

We are currently facing a limitation in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud regarding the manual clearing of checks issued (Special G/L transactions with indicator "S").

Our process involves posting outgoing payments using Special G/L indicator “S” (Check/L/C). We are using payment method C, which has been configured to use "S" as the CME indicator.

However, when we attempt to clear these open items (e.g., via the app Post Outgoing Payments - F1612 or Clear Outgoing Payments - F1367), the system does not allow the selection of items with Special G/L indicator "S", and the CME field is not available for filtering or selection.

Request:

  • Could you confirm if there is a standard Fiori app or supported process in S/4HANA Public Cloud to manually clear Special G/L items with CME indicator “S” (e.g., issued checks)?

  • If not, is there an alternative or recommended approach to handle the manual clearing of these open items?

  • Is this functionality planned for future releases?

We appreciate your support and guidance on how to manage this process within Public Cloud.

Your faithfully,

Blas Roselló

entry.title: Re: Node.js @sap/hana-client 2.25.29 getting strange erro...
entry.content:
I found out the reason/ solution!

If you do not have commoncrypto (CommonCryptoLib sapcrypto.dll) installed/ or when it for some reason fails on your system it will now error out in the new version. As the sslCryptoProvider connection property defaults to commoncrypto. If for some reason it faces errors during the set-up of the connection it will fail (but the older version then tried to set up the connection with mscrypto).

So it I fixed it by setting sslCryptoProvider to mscrypto. Here you can find a reference for all the connection properties for Node.js

@Linjun : maybe it is good to have the fallback to mscrypto again if commoncrypto fails for some reason?

entry.title: Double authorization while creating a sales order
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have implemented the DPA for our receivable payment and integrated with PSP (Snap pay & Cyber source).

When customer create an order on ourwebsite, we are already taking the authorization on credit card and when order is passed into SAP, using iDoc and order get created, SAP Standard order process is taking the authorization again. What is the standard process to avoid the duplicate authorization. How can we bypass the authorization process during creation time using iDoc.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. Pick an iDoc (Idoc # 0000000002417081) using transaction WE19 
  2. Go to segment E1EDK02 and change the sales order number to a new number which is not available in the system
  3. and click on Standard Inbound 
  4. This will trigger the sales order creation, and you can see that the SAP is taking the authorization again, but we already had the card authorization when iDoc comes in SAP

entry.title: Re: [S/4HANA Public Cloud] CDS Extraction to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello @popflorin 

The authorisation group ID must be transported from DEV to TEST via Central Business Configuration (CBC). You can’t maintain it directly in TEST if the SSCUI is in display mode; that’s expected behaviour.Check in CBC whether the relevant activity is marked as “Ready to Deploy” and make sure it has been deployed to TEST if it hasn’t, trigger the deployment from CBC.

Let me know the SSCUI number if you need help locating the activity.

Introducing SAP Central Business Configuration-SAP Learning

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Node.js @sap/hana-client 2.25.29 getting strange erro...
entry.content:
Hello, yes, setting `sslCryptoProvider` is a workaround for this issue as it forces the driver to use the specified crypto library. In your case, it forces it use msCrypto.

However, the issue you mentioned in this thread is also considered as a regression on Windows. The expected behaviour is, the driver tries to use CommonCryptoLib first, and "[i]f CommonCryptoLib is not available, OpenSSL is used by default in Linux environments, and msCrypto in Microsoft Windows environments".

Our team is now working on investigating the tracing file and trying to reproduce this issue for further debugging. In the meanwhile, please feel free to use `sslCryptoProvider` as a workaround for now.

entry.title: Re: SQL Anywhere SQL central not working after edition upgrade to advanced

entry.title: Re: Can We Bring “Import Financial Data” to SAP S/4HANA P...
entry.content:
Hello @gunadharshini 

You cannot deploy custom apps like Import Financial Data directly into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Custom UI5 app hosting is not supported in the public cloud launchpad.

Your current approach using SAP Work Zone with SAP Build Process Automation — is correct and aligns with SAP's recommended extensibility model for Public Cloud.

If needed, you can add a URL tile in the S/4HANA Launchpad that links to your app hosted on BTP.Extensibility Guide – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (SAP Help)

Extensibility Guide for GROW with SAP

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Demystifying Material Ledger Period-End Closing
entry.content:
Alvaro Alonso Suevis - SAP Senior CO Consultant. TS410 S/4HANA Certified 2022.

Transaction CKMLCP/  Transacción CKMLCP: Material Ledger Period-End Closing. Cierre deLedger de Materiales.

Step by Step Process Detailed.

 

Transaction: CKMLCP.

Costing Run: “0LMAY25”; Fiscal Year: 2025; Period: 05 (May.2025); Application: ACRU (Actual costing).

Click on “Create”.

Click on “Actual Costing run”.

Tab: Plant Assignment

Available Plants: 1149; Assigned Plants: Empty.

Move Plant 1149 from Available Plants to Assigned Plants Frame.

Click on Save button.

Message “Costing run have been saved”.

Click on Tab “Actual Costing” and Collapse General Data.

Collapse General Data.

Click on “icon” “+” on the left of “Processing”: Expand Processing.

A “Flow step” Frame is opened below the “Processing” Cockpit.

Flow step: Selection.

            Click on Parameters:

As we are going to process a single Plant “1149”, deactivate the “Background Processing” option and click on Save.

                        Message:” Values of variant 000000000002 saved. Message No. DB643”.

                        Click on Back or <F3>.              

                                    Click on Selection >> Execute.          

            Results:

Click on Back or <F3>.              

            Results: 2 Successful / 0 Errors. Click on “Save”. Material Status now is green (successful).

            Click on Selection >> Log.

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Close the window “Choose Log” and Click on “Save”.

            Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on the lock of Preparation >> Authorization:

All the Padlocks belonging to the Authorization column for Flow steps Preparation, Settlement and Post Closing are now unlocked.           

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Parameters:

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Parameters:

As we are going to process a single Plant “1149”, deactivate the “Background Processing” option and click on Save.

<Save>

Values of variant 000000000002 saved

Message No. DB643.

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Execute:

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Material Status now is green (successful).

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Log:

 

Click on “Continue”

Message : “Number of inserted MLDOC records: 2”.

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Flow step: Settlement.

            Click on Parameters:

Post Closing >> Parameters.

As we are going to process a single Plant “1149”, deactivate the “Background Processing” option and click on Save.

 

Values of variant 000000000002 saved. Message No. DB643.

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Flow step: Settlement.

            Click on Execute:

Settlement >> Execute.

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Material Status now is green (successful).

Flow step: Settlement.

            Click on Log:

Click on <Continue>.

Number of inserted MLDOC records: 1.

Number of inserted MLDOCCCS records: 1.

Number of updated MLDOC records: 2.

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Authorization:

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Parameters:

Revaluate Material: Activate.

Revaluate Consumption: Activate.

Set Account Assignment: Activate.

Click on <Save>

Values of variant 000000000002 saved

Message No. DB643

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Execute:

Post Closing >> Execute.

Click on <Exit>

Material Status now is green (successful).

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Log:

Post Closing >> Log.

Click on <Continue>

Click on <Exit>, 

All flow steps in Material Status Column are in green (successful).

                                   Material Ledger Month-end Closing Finished Successfully. 05.2025 (May.2025)

                                   Cierre de Ledger de Material Ledger Finalizado exitosamente. 05.2025 (Mayo.2025).

Fin de documento / End of the document.

entry.title: Re: compress file into zip with password protect
entry.content:
Hello @JastinC1 

You cannot password-protect ZIP files using ABAP. The available class CL_ABAP_ZIP does not support encryption, and S4 HANA Public Cloud does not allow custom libraries or OS-level tools.

To achieve password protection, you’d need to handle it externally via SAP BTP, using a ZIP library in Node.js, Java, or Python.

KBA-3534013 - Issues Reading .ZIP File of Version 4.5 Using CL_ABAP_ZIP Class Method LOAD

SAP Help Development in the ABAP Environment

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Minha experiência no SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025
entry.content:
No último sábado (26/07), tive a oportunidade de participar do SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025, um evento que me deixou motivado e, acima de tudo, grato por fazer parte dessa comunidade incrível.

Desde o momento em que entrei, o clima era de colaboração, aprendizado e inovação. Estar entre profissionais que respiram SAP, ouvindo sobre temas como SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP, Clean Core, Signavio e SAP Activate, foi como abrir uma janela para o futuro que desejo construir.

Mais do que palestras técnicas, o que me marcou foi o ambiente: acessível, acolhedor e cheio de gente com brilho nos olhos. Profissionais dispostos a compartilhar, ensinar e crescer juntos. Cada conversa, cada slide, cada café compartilhado — tudo fez sentido para quem, como eu, está trilhando o caminho para atuar com SAP S/4HANA em projetos de transformação digital.

Saí do evento com a cabeça cheia de ideias e o coração leve. Reforço aqui o quanto eventos como o SIT são fundamentais para conectar pessoas e ampliar horizontes. Que venham mais encontros como esse!

Parabéns a todos os organizadores, palestrantes e participantes. Vocês fizeram a diferença!

entry.title: Re: Multiple billing documents that contain items from ju...
entry.content:
Hello @Kaito2 

You can’t split one delivery into multiple billing documents directly via OData API like you can in the Fiori app. The API (API_BILLINGDOCUMENT_SRV) doesn’t support interactive item selection or partial quantity billing.

 To achieve the same result, you need to

  • Manually split the delivery items/quantities on your side
  • Call the API multiple times with separate payloads, each creating a billing document for a portion of the delivery

API_BILLINGDOCUMENT_SRV – SAP Business Accelerator Hub

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Many customers are running standardized processes for their Finance, Controlling and Order Management processes in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud are searching for options to integrate advanced warehouse management functionalities to cover their logistics process requirements and help them to grow their business.

With SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 a new scope item enabling integration of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud with EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud will be available, to combine standardized cloud ERP processes to be integrated with advanced warehouse management capabilities.

With this blog post are discussing questions and interesting information around the integration of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud.

Which release is required to setup the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integration?

With SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 a new scope item will be shipped - SAP EWM for SAP S/4HANA Integration (7L1). This includes the new communication scenario Logistics - S/4HANA Extended Warehouse Management Integration (SAP_COM_0A58) that enables the integration of transactional data to a decentral EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud or OnPremise.

Minimum required SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud release is 2023, FPS0 if batch master data distribution is not required. Otherwise, SAP S/4HANA Private Cloude release 2023, FPS3, introducing the batch master data distribution via DRF is the required minimum release.

Which functional scope is supported in the integration?

The following processes are supported in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud integration to a decentral EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud:

Process

Scope Item

Inbound processing from supplier

2VJ - SAP EWM Integration - Inbound Processing from Supplier

Outbound processing to customer

2VK - SAP EWM Integration - Outbound Processing to Customer

Delivery based production integration: Production supply and goods receipt

2VM - SAP EWM Integration - Delivery-Based Production Integration

Customer returns

2VO - SAP EWM Integration - Customer Returns 

Batch management - Creating batches in: 

•       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ERP system

•       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition EWM system

2VN - SAP EWM Integration - Batch Management

Stock transport orders

2VL - SAP EWM Integration - Stock Transport Orders 

What do I have to know about the technical setup of the integration?

To setup the integration there are cut-over, customizing and integration settings required to establish the integration from SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud via SAP Cloud Connector and vice versa via WebSocket. Please find detailed information about the integration via official Set-Up Instruction - Setting Up SAP EWM for SAP S/4HANA Integration (7L1).

Which deployment scenarios are supported?

We are supporting the integration of a single SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud tenant (with or without Cloud WM) to a single EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance. Additionally, a further SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance can be integration to the same EWM for SAP S/4HANA.

Please note that the SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance can only be used as a decentral EWM logistics system as the integration of multiple SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC systems to EWM on SAP S/4HANA embedded not supported (see also SAP Note 3376453 - SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS00, FPS01, FPS02 and FPS03: Release information and restrictions for EWM in SAP S/4HANA).

Are there any restriction to be considered implementing this integration to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud?

There are functional restrictions for EWM on SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integrating with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to be considered. These can be distinguished by supported processes and integration capabilities managed via Control Parameters for ERP Version Control.

Please find a list of most important processes and functions not supported in the integration in the table below:

Process/Functions

Details

Handling Unit Management in EWM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Handling Units can only be managed within SAP EWM. They are not integrated into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. Handling Units created in EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud are not transferred to deliveries in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Serial Numbers on warehouse level

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition offers Serial Numbers on the document level (A), the warehouse level (B) and the stock level (C). SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition only offers Serial Numbers on the (A) document and (C) stock levels.​ Serial Number on document and stock level supported for integration scenario only.

Transport Integration – Shipment (LE-TRA) – Transportation Unit

Integration of Transportation Units via SHPMNT05-Idoc to LE-TRA component (Shipments) is not supported in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integration.

Integration with SAP Transportation Management (TM)

The integration with Transportation Management (e.g. Via Transportation Units or Advanced Shipping and Receiving) I not supported.

Find a complete list of restrictions and learn more about the new integration between SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud via SAP Note 3629180 - Supported Processes for EWM Integration with SAP_COM_0A58 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and Higher.

entry.title: Re: Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions

entry.title: Re: Request for Alternative EarlyWatch Alert Generation f...
entry.content:
In general, EWAs can also be processed at SAP but please keep in mind this has restrictions.

 

Read SAP Notes below for all details:

 

  • ##207223 - SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP
  • ##1257308 - FAQ: Using EarlyWatch Alert

 

Regards

entry.title: Doubt Regarding Web Channel Activation
entry.content:
Hi,

 

A few days ago, I submitted a ticket to support team where I explained that Web Extend is currently not tracking website behavior events because the site isn’t integrated with Emarsys yet.

Given this context, I’d like to know: do I need to wait for the website to be fully connected to Emarsys before I can move forward with Web Channel integration? Or is there anything I can already do in the meantime to begin the setup?

Thanks in advance for your guidance on the next steps.

 

Best regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Doubt Regarding Web Channel Activation
entry.content:
Hello,

In order to use Web Channel, you don't need to be collecting events but the Web Extend main script must be installed and functional in your website. You can read more details about the requirement to work with Web Channel at the SAP Help document below:

  • SAP Emarsys Help: Getting started with Web Channel

Best regards,

SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Re: Process for Manual Completion of the Open Deliveries
entry.content:
Hi,

I agree that VL_COMPLETE can be very useful, but (actually in capital letters) you really have to know what you are doing there.

In the case you are describing (delivery with one item is rejected via process code O001) you would be fairly save to use VL_COMPLETE. But you should understand why you have an error queue on the ERP side (you are not elaborating on that) beforehand.

In any other (more complex) case you might mess up a situation quite badly. What if you have several items, some already fully picked and packed? Would you still just delete the queue and do VL_COMPLETE? Well, rather not, I assume.

I have seen VL_COMPLETE being used without prior analysis ... not much fun for the people who had to "clean up" afterwards 😉 So, just a suggestion to be thorough and careful.

Regards Andreas

entry.title: Re: Duplicate Records in Datasphere Monitor – Replication...
entry.content:
Dear 

As previously mentioned by my colleague, you could check in the source system how many records are transferred through the CDS View I_PRODUCT in an initial full load. The ODQMON transaction can help with this. 

See the link "How to check ODQMON for Replication Flow Issues."

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/datasphere/4518531178.html

Then, check if there is any truncation in the target table, if it contains the same key as the CDS.

For additional information on replication behavior, the link "Replication Flow Scenarios with Different Load Types" may also be useful.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/datasphere/4518284059.html

If these checks don't find anything, the monitor might be at fault, in which case an incident could be opened to request assistance from the support team.

Regards, André

entry.title: Range Penetration / Compa Ratio for non sales employees

Basically we need to create another pay component group for employees that are not in an 'S' grade but I'm not sure how to do that if the system only allows one pay component group to be chosen to calculate range penetration and compa ratio. Any help or guidance would be much appreciated! 

Thank you in advance!
Annie

entry.title: Rounding error in sales order
entry.content:
Hello everyone:
I have a problem with the sales order. My example is as follows:
I have an order with 7 items, the price condition is entered manually, and the total value is entered in the header.
The problem is that the total value doesn't match the customer's value. Where the items are rounded by decimals, the total value obtained is 329,492.67, and the customer's calculated value is 329,492.677. Therefore, it must be rounded to 329,492.68.
How can I adjust this value so that it calculates correctly, leaving that difference in cents in the item with the largest amount. As additional information, I cannot modify the company code currency.

entry.title: Re: Webi Query Filter - Between Formula
entry.content:
Your earlier post: =If(DaysBetween([CREATIONDATE];CurrentDate())>=0 And DaysBetween([CREATIONDATE];CurrentDate())<=7) Then "show" Else "hide"

worked out! I just had to set the filter after that to exclude "hide"

Thank you!!!

entry.title: Re: Serial number Split scenario EWM
entry.content:
Hi,

If you need to have serial number management active you cannot really split that 1 PCE to pack it into serveral HUs.

Here is an idea to get around that issue - it involves custom development though. We have used a similar idea in the furniture business where e.g. 1 sofa is being shipped in several physical pieces.

  • You pick and pack that 1 PCE of the material in an HU (let's call it "Main HU")
  • For every additional physical HU which you need for shipping you pack a dummy material into a HU (as the only item). You link these HUs to the Main HU by assigning the Main HU number as an alternative HU identification of each HU. Like that you create a logical  group of HUs that are linked to each other.
  • That is fairly straight forward if you pick the serial number managed material and use the dummy material in the packing step only.
  • It gets more complicated if you already want to create the group of HUs when you receive it to the warehouse and even more so if you want to store the HUs in different storage bins (say because you have smaller and lager HUs in the HU group)
  • Note regarding the dummy material: you obviously need stock to be able to pack that dummy material into an HU. So you either need a source storage type which allows negative stock or you create enough stock "out of the blue" to supply your packing step. Material type should be non-valuated, but stock-managed. If you already know that you do need a group of HUs to ship the 1 PCE you can add an order item line for the dummy material. Like that you get an item which needs to be picked and packed.

Happy coding, regards Andreas

entry.title: Re: SAP Screen Personas Errors in log
entry.content:
My first suggestion would be the following:

  • Delete all old versions of your flavors permanently (not just mark as deleted, but remove from database), leaving only the most recent one
  • Compress undo history of the flavors
  • Use the 'Update Object Relations' function in Health Check

These actions will remove old / obsolete references and should hopefully help in getting rid of those errors.
